name: U.S. Information Technology Sector Registry
_comment: Defines sub-industries, analytical intent, and deterministic visibility rules for the U.S. IT sector.

sub_industries.name: Software
sub_industries.description: Enterprise, application, and infrastructure software providers.

sub_industries.name: IT Services
sub_industries.description: Systems integration, managed services, and consulting.

sub_industries.name: Semiconductors & Semiconductor Equipment
sub_industries.description: Chip design, fabrication, and equipment suppliers.

sub_industries.name: Technology Hardware, Storage & Peripherals
sub_industries.description: Devices, storage, and related hardware ecosystems.

sub_industries.name: Electronic Components & Instruments
sub_industries.description: Specialty components and instrumentation for tech supply chains.

core_analytical_questions: Which regulatory and standards bodies constrain product design, data handling, and security requirements?
What are the principal demand drivers (enterprise spend, consumer upgrades, cloud adoption, public sector procurement)?
Where are supply chain chokepoints (fabs, advanced packaging, critical components)?
What is the durability of competitive advantages (intellectual property, platform lock-in, ecosystem switching costs)?
How exposed is the sub-industry to export controls or spectrum policy shifts?
What is the lifecycle cadence (hardware refresh, software renewal, services contracts)?

key_operating_metrics.description: Share of revenue tied to subscriptions, maintenance, or contracted services.
Stability of installed base and renewal behavior.
Indicative of pricing power and supply chain resilience.
Commitment to innovation relative to operating scale.
Forward demand visibility for services and equipment.
Relevant for semiconductor manufacturing and equipment providers.
Operational risk tied to cybersecurity performance and disclosures.

visibility_rules._comment: Deterministic tier-based visibility. Higher tiers are always visible to lower tiers.

constraints._comment: Sector registry inherits from macro and country registries.
